message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public class LinkedList<T> implements Iterable<T> {
    private Node<T> front;
    private class Node<T> {
        T data;
        Node<T> next;
    }
    private class LinkedListIterator implements Iterator<T> {
        private Node<T> current;
        public LinkedListIterator(Node<T> front) {
            this.current = front;
        }
        @Override
        public boolean hasNext() {
            return current != null;
        }
        @Override
        public T next() {
            if (!hasNext()) throw new NoSuchElementException();
            T data = current.data;
            current = current.next;
            return data;
        }
        @Override
        public void remove() {
            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
        }
    }
    @Override
    public Iterator<T> iterator() {
        return new LinkedListIterator(front);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Iterator interface methods (hasNext, next, remove) are implemented in a separate inner class LinkedListIterator. The LinkedList class implements the Iterable interface and provides the iterator() method which returns an instance of LinkedListIterator. This way, the LinkedList class itself does not need to implement the Iterator interface methods directly.
